article_text:
Deere & Co. plans to lay off 910 employees at factories in Iowa and Illinois, as the company scales back production in the wake of falling demand for farm equipment.

The layoffs, which will begin in early February, will affect 565 employees at plants in Waterloo, Iowa, where the company assembles high-horsepower tractors; 300 employees in Ankeny, Iowa, near Des Moines, where tillage and crop spraying equipment is made; and 45...

twitter.description: Deere announced another round of layoffs, impacting 910 employees at its agricultural equipment facilities in Iowa and Illinois, as the company scales back production amid weaker demand.
